alert.note: Alert for Boone; Campbell; Gallatin; Grant; Kenton; Owen; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 4:11PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN KENTON, SOUTHERN CAMPBELL, SOUTHERN BOONE, GRANT, NORTH CENTRAL OWEN, CENTRAL PENDLETON AND CENTRAL GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 411 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Owenton, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Independence, Williamstown, Walton, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Butler, Glencoe, Sparta, Stewartsville, Atwood, Ryle, Northcutt, Interstate 71 at US Route 127, Bracht, Gardnersville, New Liberty, Fiskburg, Sherman, Elliston and Goforth. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 59 and 77. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 154 and 174. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northern Kentucky. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Campbell; Gallatin; Grant; Kenton; Owen; Pendleton
